NEXT.TITLE: Your next steps
NEXT.DESCRIPTION: Complete the following steps to secure your application.

CREATE_PROJECT.TITLE: Create a project
CREATE_PROJECT.DESCRIPTION: Add a project and define its roles and authorizations.

GET_STARTED.TITLE: Get Started
GET_STARTED.DESCRIPTION: Follow the quick start step-by-step guide and start building immediately.

DOCS.TITLE: Documentation
DOCS.DESCRIPTION: Explore ZITADELs knowledge base to familiarize yourself with core concepts and ideas. Learn how ZITADEL works and how to use it.

EXAMPLES.TITLE: Examples and Software Development Kits
EXAMPLES.DESCRIPTION: Browse our examples and SDKs to use ZITADEL together with your favorite programming languages and tools.

ORG.TITLE: Organization
ORG.DESCRIPTION: An organization hosts users, projects with apps, identity providers and settings like company branding. Do you want to share settings across multiple organizations? Configure default settings.
ORG.METADATA: Add custom attributes to the organization like its location or an identifier in another system. You can use this information in your actions.

PROJECTS.TITLE: Projects
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION:
A project hosts one or more applications, that you can use to authenticate your users. Also you can authorize your users with projects. To allow users from other organizations to log in to your applications, grant them access to your project.

If you can't find a project, contact the projects owner or someone with the corresponding rights to gain access.

OWNED.TITLE: Owned Projects
OWNED.DESCRIPTION: These are the projects you own. You can manage these project settings, authorizations and applications.

GRANTED.TITLE: Granted Projects
GRANTED.DESCRIPTION: These are the projects that other organizations granted to you. With granted projects you can give your users access to other organisations applications.

USERS.TITLE: Users
USERS.DESCRIPTION: A user is a human or a machine that can access your applications.

HUMANS.TITLE: Users
HUMANS.DESCRIPTION: Users authenticate interactively in a browser session with a login prompt.
HUMANS.METADATA: Add custom attributes to the user like the department. You can use this information in your actions.

MACHINES.TITLE: Service Users
MACHINES.DESCRIPTION: Service Users authenticate non-interactively using a JWT bearer token signed with a private key. They can also use a personal access token.
MACHINES.METADATA: Add custom attributes to the user like the authenticating system. You can use this information in your actions.

SELF.METADATA: Add custom attributes to your user like your department. You can use this information in your organizations actions.

AUTHORIZATIONS.TITLE: Authorizations
AUTHORIZATIONS.DESCRIPTION: Authorizations define the access rights of a user to a project. You can grant a user access to a project and define the users roles within that project.

ACTIONS.TITLE: Actions
ACTIONS.DESCRIPTION: Run custom code on events that happen as your users authenticate at ZITADEL. Automate your processes, enrich your users metadata and their tokens or notify external systems.

SCRIPTS.TITLE: Scripts
SCRIPTS.DESCRIPTION: Write your JavaScript code once and trigger it in multiple flows.

FLOWS.TITLE: Flows
FLOWS.DESCRIPTION: Choose an authentication flow and trigger your action on a specific event within this flow.

INSTANCE.TITLE: Default Settings
INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: Default settings for all organizations. With the right permissions, some of them are overridable in organization settings.

ORG.TITLE: Organization Settings
ORG.DESCRIPTION: Customize the settings of your organization.

IDPS.TITLE: Identity Providers
IDPS.DESCRIPTION: Create and activate external identity providers. Choose a well-known provider or configure any other OIDC, OAuth or SAML compatible provider of your choice. You can even use your existing JWT tokens as federated identities by configuring a JWT identity provider.

SAML.TITLE: Configure your SAML Identity Provider
SAML.DESCRIPTION: ZITADEL is configured. Now your SAML Identity Provider needs some configuration. Most providers allow you to just upload the whole ZITADEL metadata XML. Other providers ask you to provide some distinct URLs only, like for example the entity ID (metadata URL), the Assertion Consumer Service (ACS) URL or the Single Logout URL.

CALLBACK.TITLE: Configure your {{ provider }} Identity Provider
CALLBACK.DESCRIPTION: Before you can configure ZITADEL, pass this URL to your Identity Provider to enable the browser redirection back to ZITADEL after authentication.

JWT.TITLE: Use JWTs as federated Identities
JWT.DESCRIPTION: The JWT Identity Provider enables you to use your existing JWT tokens as federated identities. This feature is handy if you already have an issuer for JWTs. With a JWT IdP, you can use these JWTs to create and update users in ZITADEL on-the-fly.

LDAP.TITLE: Configure ZITADEL to connect to your LDAP Identity Provider
LDAP.DESCRIPTION: Provide the connection details to your LDAP server and configure the mapping of your LDAP attributes to ZITADEL attributes.

AUTOFILL.TITLE: Autofill user data
AUTOFILL.DESCRIPTION: Use an action to improve your users experience. You can pre-fill ZITADELs registration form with values from the identity provider.

ACTIVATE.TITLE: Activate the IdP
ACTIVATE.DESCRIPTION: Your IdP is not active yet. Activate it to allow your users to log in.

PW_COMPLEXITY.TITLE: Password Complexity
PW_COMPLEXITY.DESCRIPTION: Ensure your users use strong passwords by defining complexity rules.

BRANDING.TITLE: Branding
BRANDING.DESCRIPTION: Customize the look and feel of your login form. Remember to apply your configuration when you are done.

PRIVACY_POLICY.TITLE: External Links
PRIVACY_POLICY.DESCRIPTION: Guide your users to custom external resources shown on the login page. Users need to accept the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy before they can sign up. Change the link to your documentation or set an empty string to hide the documentation button from the console. Add a custom external link and a custom text for that link in the console, or set them empty to hide that button.

SMTP_PROVIDER.TITLE: SMTP Settings
SMTP_PROVIDER.DESCRIPTION: Configure your SMTP server to use a domain for the sender address that your users know and trust.

SMS_PROVIDER.TITLE: SMS Settings
SMS_PROVIDER.DESCRIPTION: To unlock all ZITADEL features, configure Twilio to send SMS messages to your users.

IAM_EVENTS.TITLE: Events
IAM_EVENTS.DESCRIPTION: This page show all state changes in your instance as far back as your instances audit trail limit. Filter the list by time range for debugging purposes or filter it by an aggregate for auditing purposes.

IAM_FAILED_EVENTS.TITLE: Failed Events
IAM_FAILED_EVENTS.DESCRIPTION: This page shows all failed events in your instance. If ZITADEL doesn't behave as you expect, always check this this list first.

IAM_VIEWS.TITLE: Views
IAM_VIEWS.DESCRIPTION: This page shows all your database views and when they processed their latest event. If you miss some data, check if the view is up to date.

LANGUAGES.TITLE: Languages
LANGUAGES.DESCRIPTION: Restrict the languages that the login form and the notification messages are translated to. If you want to disable some of the languages, drag them to the Not Allowed Languages section. You can specify an allowed language as the default language. If a users preferred language is not allowed, the default language is used.

SECRET_GENERATORS.TITLE: Secret Generators
SECRET_GENERATORS.DESCRIPTION: Define your secrets complexities and lifetimes. A higher complexity and lifetime improves security, a lower complexity and lifetime improves decryption performance.

SECURITY.TITLE: Security Settings
SECURITY.DESCRIPTION: Enable ZITADEL features that can have security impacts. You really should know what you are doing before you change these settings.

OIDC.TITLE: OpenID Connect Settings
OIDC.DESCRIPTION: Configure your OIDC token lifetimes. Use shorter lifetimes to increase your users security, use longer lifetimes to increase your users convenience.

ACCESS_TOKEN.TITLE: Access Token
ACCESS_TOKEN.DESCRIPTION: The access token is used to authenticate a user. It is a short-lived token that is used to access the user's data. Use a short lifetime to minimize the risk of unauthorized access. Access tokens can automatically be refreshed using a refresh token.

ID_TOKEN.TITLE: ID Token
ID_TOKEN.DESCRIPTION: The ID token is a JSON Web Token (JWT) that contains claims about the user. The ID token lifetime should not exceed the access token lifetime.

REFRESH_TOKEN.TITLE: Refresh Token
REFRESH_TOKEN.DESCRIPTION: The refresh token is used to obtain a new access token. It is a long-lived token that is used to refresh the access token. A user has to manually re-authenticate when the refresh token expires.

REFRESH_TOKEN_IDLE.TITLE: Idle Refresh Token
REFRESH_TOKEN_IDLE.DESCRIPTION: The idle refresh token lifetime is the maximum time a refresh token can be unused.

MESSAGE_TEXTS.TITLE: Message Texts
MESSAGE_TEXTS.DESCRIPTION: Customize the texts of your notification email or SMS messages. If you want to disable some of the languages, restrict them in your instances language settings.

TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.DC: When you claim a domain for your organization, users who don't use this domain in their login name will be prompted to change their login name to match the claimed domain.
TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.INIT: When a user is created, they will receive an email with a link to set their password.
TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.PC: When a user changes their password, they will receive a notification about the change if you have enabled this in the notification settings.
TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.PL: When a user adds a passwordless authentication method, they need to activate it by clicking a link in an email.
TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.PR: When a user resets their password, they will receive an email with a link to set a new password.
TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.VE: When a user changes their email address, they will receive an email with a link to verify the new address.
TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.VP: When a user changes their phone number, they will receive an SMS with a code to verify the new number.
TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.VEO: When a user adds a One-Time Password via email method, they need to activate it by entering a code sent to their email address.
TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.VSO: When a user adds a One-Time Password via SMS method, they need to activate it by entering a code sent to their phone number.
TYPE_DESCRIPTIONS.IU: When a user invite code is created, they will receive an email with a link to set their authentication method.

LOGIN_TEXTS.TITLE: Login Interface Texts
LOGIN_TEXTS.DESCRIPTION: Customize the texts of your login form. If a text is empty, the placeholder shows the default value. If you want to disable some of the languages, restrict them in your instances language settings.

DOMAINS.TITLE: Domain Settings
DOMAINS.DESCRIPTION: Define restrictions on your domains and configure your login name patterns.

REQUIRE_VERIFICATION.TITLE: Require custom domains to be be verified
REQUIRE_VERIFICATION.DESCRIPTION: If this is activated, organization domains have to be verified before they can be used for domain discovery or username suffixing.

LOGIN_NAME_PATTERN.TITLE: Login Name Pattern
LOGIN_NAME_PATTERN.DESCRIPTION: Control the pattern of your users login names. ZITADEL selects your users organization as soon as they enter their login name. Therefore the loginnames need to be unique across all organizations. If you have users that have an account in multiple domains, you can ensure uniqueness by suffixing your login names with the organization domain.

DOMAIN_VERIFICATION.TITLE: Domain Verification
DOMAIN_VERIFICATION.DESCRIPTION: Only allow your organization to use the domains they actually control. If activated, organization domains are periodically verified by DNS or HTTP challenge before they can be used. This is a security feature to prevent domain hijacking.

SMTP_SENDER_ADDRESS.TITLE: SMTP Sender Address
SMTP_SENDER_ADDRESS.DESCRIPTION: Only allow an SMTP sender address if it matches one of your instance domains.

LIFETIMES.TITLE: Login Lifetimes
LIFETIMES.DESCRIPTION: Harden your security by reducing some login-related maximum lifetimes.
LIFETIMES.LABEL: Maximum Lifetime in hours

PW_CHECK.TITLE: Password Check
PW_CHECK.DESCRIPTION: Users will be required to re-authenticate with their password after this period.

EXT_LOGIN_CHECK.TITLE: External Login Check
EXT_LOGIN_CHECK.DESCRIPTION: Your users are redirected to their external identity providers after this periods.

MULTI_FACTOR_INIT.TITLE: Multifactor Init Check
MULTI_FACTOR_INIT.DESCRIPTION: Your users will be prompted to set up a second factor or a Multifactor after this periods if they haven't done so already. A lifetime of 0 deactivates this prompt.

SECOND_FACTOR_CHECK.TITLE: Second Factor Check
SECOND_FACTOR_CHECK.DESCRIPTION: Your users have to revalidate their second factor in these periods.

MULTI_FACTOR_CHECK.TITLE: Multifactor Check
MULTI_FACTOR_CHECK.DESCRIPTION: Your users have to revalidate their Multifactor in these periods.

USERNAME_PASSWORD_ALLOWED.TITLE: Username and Password allowed
USERNAME_PASSWORD_ALLOWED.DESCRIPTION: Allow your users to log in with their username and password. If this is deactivated, your users can only log in using passwordless authentication or with an external identity provider.

USER_REGISTRATION_ALLOWED.TITLE: User Registration allowed
USER_REGISTRATION_ALLOWED.DESCRIPTION: Allow anonymous users to create an account.

ORG_REGISTRATION_ALLOWED.TITLE: Organization Registration allowed
ORG_REGISTRATION_ALLOWED.DESCRIPTION: Allow anonymous users to create an organization.

EXTERNAL_LOGIN_ALLOWED.TITLE: External Login allowed
EXTERNAL_LOGIN_ALLOWED.DESCRIPTION: Allow your users to log in with an external identity provider instead of using the ZITADEL user to log in.

HIDE_PASSWORD_RESET.TITLE: Password Reset hidden
HIDE_PASSWORD_RESET.DESCRIPTION: Do not allow your users to reset their password.

DOMAIN_DISCOVERY_ALLOWED.TITLE: Domain Discovery allowed
DOMAIN_DISCOVERY_ALLOWED.DESCRIPTION: Find your users organizations depending on their login names domain, for example their email address.

IGNORE_UNKNOWN_USERNAMES.TITLE: Ignore unknown Usernames
IGNORE_UNKNOWN_USERNAMES.DESCRIPTION: If this is activated, the login form will not show an error message if the username is unknown. This helps to prevent username guessing.

DISABLE_EMAIL_LOGIN.TITLE: Disable Email Login
DISABLE_EMAIL_LOGIN.DESCRIPTION: If this is activated, your users can't use their email addresses to log in. Beware that if you deactivate this, your users email addresses must be unique accross all organizations in order to log in.

DISABLE_PHONE_LOGIN.TITLE: Disable Phone Login
DISABLE_PHONE_LOGIN.DESCRIPTION: If this is activated, your users can't use their phone numbers to log in. Beware that if you deactivate this, your users phone numbers must be unique accross all organizations in order to log in.

HOME.DISCLAIMER: ZITADEL treats your data confidentially and securely.

SHORTCUTS.REORDER: Hold and drag the tile to move it
SHORTCUTS.ADD: Hold and drag a tile to add

CARD.TITLE: Get your ZITADEL running
CARD.DESCRIPTION: This checklist helps to setup your instance and guides your through the most essential steps

instance.policy.label.added.title: Setup your brand
instance.policy.label.added.description: Define coloring and shape of your login and upload your logo and icons.

instance.smtp.config.added.title: Setup your SMTP settings
instance.smtp.config.added.description: Set your own mail server settings.

PROJECT_CREATED.title: Create a project
PROJECT_CREATED.description: Add a project and define its roles and authorizations.

APPLICATION_CREATED.title: Register your app
APPLICATION_CREATED.description: Register your web, native, api or saml application and setup an authentication flow.

AUTHENTICATION_SUCCEEDED_ON_APPLICATION.title: Log in to your app
AUTHENTICATION_SUCCEEDED_ON_APPLICATION.description: Integrate your application with ZITADEL for authentication and test it by logging in with your admin user.

user.grant.added.title: Grant users
user.grant.added.description: Allow users to access your application and setup their role.

MENU.IAMADMIN: You are an IAM Administrator. Note that you have extended permissions.

QUICKSTART.TITLE: Integrate ZITADEL into your application
QUICKSTART.DESCRIPTION: Integrate ZITADEL into your application or use one of our samples to get started in minutes.
QUICKSTART.REVIEWCONFIGURATION_DESCRIPTION: We've created a basic configuration for {{value}} applications. You can adapt this configuration to your needs after creation.
QUICKSTART.DEVMODEWARN: Dev Mode is enabled by default. You can update values for production later.
QUICKSTART.DUPLICATEAPPRENAME: An app with the same name exists already. Please choose a different name.

CHANGE.TITLE: Change Framework
CHANGE.DESCRIPTION: Choose one of the available frameworks for quick setup of your application.

DIALOG.DESCRIPTION: Are you sure you want to discard this new action? Your action will be lost

MEMBERROLES.IAM_OWNER: Has control over the whole instance, including all organizations
MEMBERROLES.IAM_OWNER_VIEWER: Has permission to review the whole instance, including all organizations
MEMBERROLES.IAM_ORG_MANAGER: Has permission to create and manage organizations
MEMBERROLES.IAM_USER_MANAGER: Has permission to create and manage users
MEMBERROLES.IAM_ADMIN_IMPERSONATOR: Has permission to impersonate admin and end users from all organizations
MEMBERROLES.IAM_END_USER_IMPERSONATOR: Has permission to impersonate end users from all organizations
MEMBERROLES.ORG_OWNER: Has permission over the whole organization
MEMBERROLES.ORG_USER_MANAGER: Has permission to create and manage users of the organization
MEMBERROLES.ORG_OWNER_VIEWER: Has permission to review the whole organization
MEMBERROLES.ORG_USER_PERMISSION_EDITOR: Has permission to manage user grants
MEMBERROLES.ORG_PROJECT_PERMISSION_EDITOR: Has permission to manage project grants
MEMBERROLES.ORG_PROJECT_CREATOR: Has permission to create his own projects and underlying settings
MEMBERROLES.ORG_ADMIN_IMPERSONATOR: Has permission to impersonate admin and end users from the organization
MEMBERROLES.ORG_END_USER_IMPERSONATOR: Has permission to impersonate end users from the organization
MEMBERROLES.PROJECT_OWNER: Has permission over the whole project
MEMBERROLES.PROJECT_OWNER_VIEWER: Has permission to review the whole project
MEMBERROLES.PROJECT_OWNER_GLOBAL: Has permission over the whole project
MEMBERROLES.PROJECT_OWNER_VIEWER_GLOBAL: Has permission to review the whole project
MEMBERROLES.PROJECT_GRANT_OWNER: Has permission to manage the project grant
MEMBERROLES.PROJECT_GRANT_OWNER_VIEWER: Has permission to review the project grant

ORGSWITCHER.TEXT: All organization settings and tables in console are based on a selected organization. Click this button to switch organization or create a new one.

INSTANCE.TEXT: Click here to get to the default settings. Note that you have only access to this button if you have enhanced permissions.

PROFILE.TEXT: Here you can switch between your user accounts and manage your sessions and profile.

NAV.TEXT: This navigation changes based on your selected organization above or your instance

SWITCHEDTOINSTANCE.TEXT: The view just changed to instance!

TOKENINVALID.TITLE: Your authorization token has expired.
TOKENINVALID.DESCRIPTION: Click the button below to log in again.

EXHAUSTED.TITLE: Your instance is blocked.
EXHAUSTED.DESCRIPTION: Ask your ZITADEL instance administrator to update the subscription.

ERRORS.NOTANEMAIL: The given value is not an e-mail address.
ERRORS.MINLENGTH: Must be at least {{requiredLength}} characters long.
ERRORS.SYMBOLERROR: Must include a symbol or punctuation mark.
ERRORS.PWNOTEQUAL: The passwords provided do not match.
ERRORS.PHONE: The phone number must start with +.

USER.TITLE: Personal Information
USER.DESCRIPTION: Manage your information and security settings.

PAGES.TITLE: User
PAGES.LOCKEDDESCRIPTION: This user has been locked out due to exceeding the maximum login attempts and must be unlocked to be used again.
PAGES.DELETEACCOUNT_DESC: If you perform this action, you will be logged out and will no longer have access to your account. This action is not reversible, so please continue with caution.

DIALOG.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to permanently delete a user. Are you sure?
DIALOG.DELETE_SELF_DESCRIPTION: You are about to permanently delete your personal account. This will log you out and delete your user. This action cannot be undone!
DIALOG.DELETE_AUTH_DESCRIPTION: You are about to permanently delete your personal account. Are you sure?
DIALOG.TYPEUSERNAME: Type '{{value}}', to confirm and delete the user.

SENDEMAILDIALOG.TITLE: Send Email Notification
SENDEMAILDIALOG.DESCRIPTION: Click the button below to send a notification to the current email address or change the email address in the field.

SECRETDIALOG.CLIENTSECRET_DESCRIPTION: Keep your client secret at a safe place as it will disappear once the dialog is closed.

PASSWORDLESS.NAME: Name
PASSWORDLESS.TITLE: Passwordless Authentication
PASSWORDLESS.DESCRIPTION: Add WebAuthn based Authentication Methods to log onto ZITADEL passwordless.
PASSWORDLESS.MANAGE_DESCRIPTION: Manage the second factor methods of your users.
PASSWORDLESS.U2F_DIALOG_DESCRIPTION: Enter a name for your used passwordless Login

TYPE.2: Fingerprint, Security Keys, Face ID and other

DIALOG.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete a passwordless Authentication method. Are you sure?
DIALOG.ADD_DESCRIPTION: Select one of the available options for creating a passwordless authentication method.
DIALOG.SEND_DESCRIPTION: Send yourself a registration link to your email address.
DIALOG.SENT: The email was successfully delivered. Check your mailbox to continue with the setup.
DIALOG.QRCODE_DESCRIPTION: Generate QR code for scanning with another device.
DIALOG.QRCODE_SCAN: Scan this QR code to continue with the setup on your device.
DIALOG.NEW_DESCRIPTION: Use this device to set up Passwordless.

MFA.NAME: Name
MFA.TITLE: Multifactor Authentication
MFA.DESCRIPTION: Add a second factor to ensure optimal security for your account.
MFA.MANAGE_DESCRIPTION: Manage the second factor methods of your users.
MFA.OTP: Authenticator App for TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password)
MFA.OTP_DIALOG_DESCRIPTION: Scan the QR code with an authenticator app and enter the code below to verify and activate the OTP method.
MFA.U2F: Fingerprint, Security Keys, Face ID and other
MFA.U2F_DIALOG_DESCRIPTION: Enter a name for your used universal Multifactor.
MFA.SETUPOTPSMSDESCRIPTION: Do you want to setup this phonenumber as OTP (One-Time password) second factor?
MFA.OTPSMSSUCCESS: OTP factor set up with success.
MFA.OTPSMSPHONEMUSTBEVERIFIED: Your phone must be verified in order to use this method.
MFA.OTPEMAILSUCCESS: OTP factor set up with success.

TYPE.2: Fingerprint, Security Keys, Face ID and other

DIALOG.MFA_DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete a second factor. Are you sure?
DIALOG.ADD_MFA_DESCRIPTION: Select one of the following options.

DIALOG.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete an Identity Provider from a user. Do you really want to continue?

CREATE.TITLE: Create a New User
CREATE.INITMAILDESCRIPTION: If both options are selected, no email for initialization will be sent. If only one of the options is selected, a mail to provide / verify the data will be sent.

CODEDIALOG.TITLE: Verify Phone Number
CODEDIALOG.DESCRIPTION: Enter the code you received by text message to verify your phone number.

PROFILE.TITLE: Profile
PROFILE.PHONE_HINT: Use the + symbol followed by the calling country code, or select the country from the dropdown and finally enter the phone number
PROFILE.CHANGEUSERNAME_DESC: Enter the new name in the field below.

AVATAR.CROPPERERROR: An error while uploading your file occurred. Try a different format and size if necessary.

MACHINE.TITLE: Service User Details
MACHINE.NAME: Name
MACHINE.KEYSDESC: Define your keys and add an optional expiration date.
MACHINE.TOKENSDESC: Personal access tokens function like ordinary OAuth access tokens.

ADD.TITLE: Add Key
ADD.DESCRIPTION: Select your key type and choose an optional expiration date.

ADDED.TITLE: The key was created
ADDED.DESCRIPTION: Download the key as it won't be visible after closing this dialog!

DELETE_KEY.TITLE: Delete Key
DELETE_KEY.DESCRIPTION: Do you want to delete the selected key? This cannot be undone.

PASSWORD.TITLE: Password
PASSWORD.LABEL: A secure password helps to protect the account
PASSWORD.DESCRIPTION: Enter the new password according to the policy below.
PASSWORD.MINLENGTHERROR: Must be at least {{value}} characters long.

LOGINMETHODS.TITLE: Contact Information
LOGINMETHODS.DESCRIPTION: The provided information is used to send important information, like password reset e-mails to you.

EMAIL.TITLE: E-mail
EMAIL.ISVERIFIEDDESC: If the email is indicated as verified, no email verification request will be made.
EMAIL.EDITDESC: Enter the new email in the field below.

PHONE.TITLE: Phone
PHONE.EDITDESC: Enter the new phone number in the field below.
PHONE.DELETEDESC: Do you really want to delete the phone number
PHONE.OTPSMSREMOVALWARNING: This account uses this phone number as second factor. You won't be able to use it after you proceed.

GRANTS.TITLE: User Grants
GRANTS.DESCRIPTION: Grant this user access to certain projects

CREATE.TITLE: Create User Grant
CREATE.DESCRIPTION: Search for the organization, the project and the corresponding project roles.

TARGET.SELF: If you want to grant a user of an other organization
TARGET.EXTERNAL: To grant a user of your organization

USER.SIGNEDOUT: You are signed out. Click the button "Sign In" to sign in again.

MEMBERSHIPS.TITLE: ZITADEL Manager Roles
MEMBERSHIPS.DESCRIPTION: These are all member grants of the user. You can modify them also on organization, project, or IAM detail pages.
MEMBERSHIPS.ORGCONTEXT: You see all organizations and projects that are related to the currently selected organization.
MEMBERSHIPS.USERCONTEXT: You see all organizations and projects to which you are authorized. Including other organizations.
MEMBERSHIPS.NOPERMISSIONTOEDIT: You are missing the required permissions to edit roles!

ADD.TITLE: Generate new Personal Access Token
ADD.DESCRIPTION: Define a custom expiration for the token.

ADDED.TITLE: Personal Access Token
ADDED.DESCRIPTION: Make sure to copy your personal access token. You won't be able to see it again!

DELETE.TITLE: Delete Token
DELETE.DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete the personal access token. Are you sure?

FLOWS.NAME: Name

ALLOWEDTOFAILWARN.TITLE: Warning
ALLOWEDTOFAILWARN.DESCRIPTION: If you disable this setting, it may cause users in your organization to be unable to sign in. Additionally, you will no longer be able to access the console to disable the action. We recommend creating an administrator user in a separate organization or testing scripts first in a development environment or a development organization.

FLOWS.ACTIONSMAX: Based on your Tier, you have available a limited Number of Actions ({{value}}). Make sure to deactivate those you are not in need or consider upgrading your tier.

DELETEACTION.TITLE: Delete Action?
DELETEACTION.DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete an action. This cannot be reverted. Are you sure?

CLEAR.TITLE: Clear flow?
CLEAR.DESCRIPTION: You are about to reset the flow along with its triggers and actions. This change cannot be restored. Are you sure?

REMOVEACTIONSLIST.TITLE: Delete selected Actions?
REMOVEACTIONSLIST.DESCRIPTION: Are you sure you want to delete the selected actions from the flow?

DIALOG.ABOUTNAME: The name of the action and the name of the function in the javascript have to be the same

POLICIES.TITLE: System Policies and Access Settings
POLICIES.DESCRIPTION: Manage your global Policies and Management Access Settings.

EVENTSTORE.TITLE: IAM Storage Administration
EVENTSTORE.DESCRIPTION: Manage your ZITADEL views and failed events.

MEMBER.TITLE: Managers
MEMBER.DESCRIPTION: These Managers are allowed to make changes in your instance.

DIALOG.VIEW_CLEAR_DESCRIPTION: You are about to clear a view. Clearing a view creates a process during which data is possibly not available for endusers. Are you really sure?

PAGES.NAME: Name
PAGES.NOPERMISSION: You don't have the permission to access organization settings.
PAGES.USERSELFACCOUNT: Use your personal account as organization owner
PAGES.ORGDETAIL_TITLE: Enter the name and domain of your new organization.
PAGES.ORGDETAIL_TITLE_WITHOUT_DOMAIN: Enter the name of your new organization.

RENAME.TITLE: Rename Organization
RENAME.DESCRIPTION: Enter the new name for your organization

ORGDOMAIN.TITLE: Verify {{value}} ownership
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION: We offer you two methods to manually validate your domain:
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_HTML: - HTTP. Host a temporary verification file on your website
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_DNS: - DNS. Create a TXT Record DNS entry
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_DNS_DESC: If you manage {{ value }} and you have access to your DNS records, you can create a new TXT record with the following values:
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_DNS_CHALLENGE_LABEL: Use this code for the value of the TXT record:
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_HTTP_DESC: If you have access to your website hosting, simply download the verification file and upload it at the provided URL
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_SKIP: You can skip verification for now and continue to create your organization, but in order to use your domain this step has to be completed!
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_VALIDATION_DESC: Do not delete the verification code, as ZITADEL will re-check the ownership of your domain from time to time.
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_VALIDATION_ONGOING: The {{ value }} method has been selected to verify your domain. Click on the button to trigger a verification check or reset the verification process.

PAGES.USEPASSWORDDESC: The user does not have to set the password during initialization.

LIST.TITLE: Organizations
LIST.DESCRIPTION: These are the organizations on your instance

DOMAINS.TITLE: Verified domains
DOMAINS.DESCRIPTION: Configure your organization domains. This domain can be used for domain discovery and username suffixing.

DELETE.TITLE: Delete Domain
DELETE.DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete one of your domains.

ADD.TITLE: Add Domain
ADD.DESCRIPTION: You are about to add a domain for your organization. After successful process, the domain can be used for domain discovery and as suffix for your users.

MEMBER.TITLE: Organization Managers
MEMBER.DESCRIPTION: Define the users who can change your organizations preferences.

TOAST.DEFAULTORGNOTFOUND: The default organization was not found

DEACTIVATE.TITLE: Deactivate organization
DEACTIVATE.DESCRIPTION: You are about to deactivate your organization. Users won't be able to login afterwards. Are you sure to proceed?

REACTIVATE.TITLE: Reactivate organization
REACTIVATE.DESCRIPTION: You are about to reactivate your organization. Users will be able to login again. Are you sure to proceed?

DELETE.TITLE: Delete organization
DELETE.DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete your organization. This initiates a process where all organization related data will be deleted. You can not revert this action as for now.

SMTP.TITLE: SMTP Provider
SMTP.REQUIREDWARN: To send notifications from your domain, you have to enter your SMTP data.

SMS.ADDPROVIDERDESCRIPTION: Choose one of the available providers and enter the required data.
SMS.REMOVEPROVIDER_DESC: You are about to delete a provider configuration. Do you want to continue?

TWILIO.VERIFYSERVICESID_DESCRIPTION: Setting a Verification Service Sid, allows using the Twilio Verify Service instead of the Messages Service for verification of phone numbers and OTP SMS

SECURITY.IFRAMEDESCRIPTION: This setting sets the CSP to allow framing from a set of allowed domains. Note that by enabling the use of iFrames, you run the risk of allowing clickjacking.
SECURITY.IMPERSONATIONDESCRIPTION: This setting allows to use impersonation in principle. Note that the impersonator needs the appropriate `*_IMPERSONATOR` roles assigned as well.

FEATURES.LOGINDEFAULTORG_DESCRIPTION: The login UI will use the settings of the default org (and not from the instance) if no organization context is set
FEATURES.OIDCLEGACYINTROSPECTION_DESCRIPTION: We have recently refactored the introspection endpoint for performance reasons. This feature can be used to rollback to the legacy implementation if unexpected bugs arise.
FEATURES.OIDCTOKENEXCHANGE_DESCRIPTION: Enable the experimental urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange grant type for the OIDC token endpoint. Token exchange can be used to request tokens with a lesser scope or impersonate other users. See the security policy to allow impersonation on an instance.
FEATURES.OIDCTRIGGERINTROSPECTIONPROJECTIONS_DESC: Enable projection triggers during an introspection request. This can act as workaround if there are noticeable consistency issues in the introspection response but can have an impact on performance. We are planning to remove triggers for introspection requests in the future.
FEATURES.USERSCHEMA_DESCRIPTION: User Schemas allow to manage data schemas of user. If the flag is enabled, you'll be able to use the new API and its features.
FEATURES.ACTIONS_DESCRIPTION: Actions v2 allow to manage data executions and targets. If the flag is enabled, you'll be able to use the new API and its features.
FEATURES.OIDCSINGLEV1SESSIONTERMINATION_DESCRIPTI: If the flag is enabled, you'll be able to terminate a single session from the login UI by providing an id_token with a `sid` claim as id_token_hint on the end_session endpoint. Note that currently all sessions from the same user agent (browser) are terminated in the login UI. Sessions managed through the Session API already allow the termination of single sessions.
FEATURES.INHERITED_DESCRIPTION: This sets the value to the default value of the system.

RESET.DEFAULTDESCRIPTION: You are about to reset your settings to the default configuration of your instance. Are you sure you want to continue?
RESET.LOGINPOLICY_DESCRIPTION: Warning: If your continue, Identity Provider settings will be reset to the instance setting too.

PWD_COMPLEXITY.TITLE: Password Complexity
PWD_COMPLEXITY.DESCRIPTION: Ensures that all set passwords correspond to a specific pattern
PWD_COMPLEXITY.SYMBOLANDNUMBERERROR: Must consist of a digit and a symbol/punctuation mark.
PWD_COMPLEXITY.PATTERNERROR: The password does not meet the required pattern.

NOTIFICATION.TITLE: Notification
NOTIFICATION.DESCRIPTION: Determines on which changes, notifications will be sent.

PRIVATELABELING.DESCRIPTION: Give the login your personalized style and modify its behavior.
PRIVATELABELING.PREVIEW_DESCRIPTION: Changes of the policy will automatically deployed to preview environment.
PRIVATELABELING.USEOFLOGO: Your Logo will be used in the Login as well as emails, while the icon is used for smaller UI elements like in the organization switcher in console
PRIVATELABELING.MAXSIZE: The maximum size is limited to 524kB
PRIVATELABELING.EMAILNOSVG: The SVG file format is not supported in emails. Therefore upload your logo in PNG or other supported format.
PRIVATELABELING.FONTINLOGINONLY: The font is currently only displayed in the login interface.

PWD_AGE.TITLE: Password Expiry
PWD_AGE.DESCRIPTION: You can set a policy for the expiry of passwords. This policy will force the user to change the password on the next login after the expiration. There are no automatic warnings and notifications.

PWD_LOCKOUT.TITLE: Lockout Policy
PWD_LOCKOUT.DESCRIPTION: Set a maximum number of password-retries, after which accounts will be blocked.

PRIVATELABELING_POLICY.TITLE: Branding
PRIVATELABELING_POLICY.DESCRIPTION: Customize the appearance of the Login

LOGIN_POLICY.TITLE: Login Settings
LOGIN_POLICY.DESCRIPTION: Define how Users can be authenticated and configure Identity Providers
LOGIN_POLICY.DESCRIPTIONCREATEADMIN: Users can choose from the available identity providers below.
LOGIN_POLICY.DESCRIPTIONCREATEMGMT: Users can choose from the available identity providers below. Note: You can use System-set providers as well as providers set for your organization only.

PRIVACY_POLICY.DESCRIPTION: Set your Privacy Policy and Terms of Service Links
PRIVACY_POLICY.RESET_DESCRIPTION: You are about to restore the default Links for TOS and Privacy Policy. Do you really want to continue?

LOGIN_TEXTS.TITLE: Login Interface Texts
LOGIN_TEXTS.DESCRIPTION: Define your texts for the login interfaces. If texts are empty, the default Value shown as the placeholder will be used.
LOGIN_TEXTS.DESCRIPTION_SHORT: Define your texts for the login interfaces.
LOGIN_TEXTS.RESET_DESCRIPTION: You are about to restore all default values. All changes you have made will be permanently deleted. Do you really want to continue?
LOGIN_TEXTS.UNSAVED_DESCRIPTION: You have made changes without saving. Do you want to save now?
LOGIN_TEXTS.ACTIVE_LANGUAGE_NOT_ALLOWED: You selected a language that is not allowed. You can go on modifying the texts. But if you want your users to actually be able to use this language, change your instances restrictions.

POLICY.DEFAULTLABEL: The current settings corresponds to the standard of your Instance.

DATA.USERLOGINMUSTBEDOMAIN: Add organization domain as suffix to loginnames
DATA.USERLOGINMUSTBEDOMAIN_DESCRIPTION: If you enable this setting, all loginnames will be suffixed with the organization domain. If this settings is disabled, you have to ensure that usernames are unique over all organizations.
DATA.VALIDATEORGDOMAINS: Organization domain verification required (DNS or HTTP challenge)
DATA.SMTPSENDERADDRESSMATCHESINSTANCEDOMAIN: SMTP Sender Address matches Instance Domain
DATA.ALLOWUSERNAMEPASSWORD_DESC: The conventional login with user name and password is allowed.
DATA.ALLOWEXTERNALIDP_DESC: The login is allowed for the underlying identity providers
DATA.ALLOWREGISTER_DESC: If the option is selected, an additional step for registering a user appears in the login.
DATA.FORCEMFALOCALONLY: Force MFA for local authenticated users
DATA.FORCEMFALOCALONLY_DESC: If the option is selected, local authenticated users have to configure a second factor for login.
DATA.HIDEPASSWORDRESET_DESC: If the option is selected, the user can't reset his password in the login process.
DATA.HIDELOGINNAMESUFFIX_DESC: Hides the login name suffix in the login interface
DATA.IGNOREUNKNOWNUSERNAMES_DESC: If the option is selected, the password screen will be displayed in the login process even if the user was not found. The error on the password check will not disclose if the username or password was wrong.
DATA.ALLOWDOMAINDISCOVERY_DESC: If the option is selected, the suffix (@domain.com) of an unknown username input on the login screen will be matched against the organization domains and will redirect to the registration of that organisation on success.
DATA.DEFAULTREDIRECTURI_DESC: Defines where the user will be redirected to if the login has started without an app context (e.g. from mail)
DATA.DISABLEWATERMARK_DESC: Hide Powered by ZITADEL watermark in the login interface

ORG_DETAIL.TITLE: Organization
ORG_DETAIL.DESCRIPTION: Here you can edit the configuration of your organization and manage the members.

MEMBER.TITLE: Members
MEMBER.ADDDESCRIPTION: Enter the names of the users to be added.

PAGES.TITLE: Project
PAGES.DESCRIPTION: Here you can define applications, manage roles and grant other organizations to use your project.
PAGES.ZITADELPROJECT: This belongs to the ZITADEL project. Beware: If you make changes ZITADEL may not behave as intended.

0.TITLE: Unspecified
0.DESC: As soon as the user is identified, the branding of the organization of the identified user will be shown, before the system default is shown.

1.TITLE: Use project setting
1.DESC: The branding of the organization which owns the project will be shown

2.TITLE: Use User Organization setting
2.DESC: The branding of the organization of the project will be shown, but as soon as the user is identified, the setting of the organization of the identified user, will be shown.

DIALOG.TITLE: Branding Setting
DIALOG.DESCRIPTION: Select the behavior of the login, when using the project.

REACTIVATE.TITLE: Reactivate Project
REACTIVATE.DESCRIPTION: Do you really want to reactivate your project?

DEACTIVATE.TITLE: Deactivate Project
DEACTIVATE.DESCRIPTION: Do you really want to deactivate your project?

DELETE.TITLE: Delete Project
DELETE.DESCRIPTION: Do you really want to delete your project?
DELETE.TYPENAME: Type the name of the project to delete it permanently.

PROJECT.NAME: Name

NAMEDIALOG.TITLE: Rename Project
NAMEDIALOG.DESCRIPTION: Enter the new name for your project
NAMEDIALOG.NAME: New Name

MEMBER.TITLE: Managers
MEMBER.TITLEDESC: Managers can make changes to this project based on their role.
MEMBER.DESCRIPTION: These managers may be able to edit your project.

GRANT.TITLE: Project Grants
GRANT.DESCRIPTION: Allow another organization to use your project.

CREATE.TITLE: Create Organization Grant
CREATE.SEL_USERS: Select the users you wish to grant access
CREATE.SEL_ROLES: Select the roles you want to be added to the grant
CREATE.ORG_DESCRIPTION: You are about to grant a user for the organization {{name}}.
CREATE.ORG_DESCRIPTION_DESC: Switch the context in the header above to grant a user for another organization.

DETAIL.TITLE: Project Grant
DETAIL.DESC: You can select which roles can be used by the specified organization, and elect managers
DETAIL.MEMBERDESC: These are the managers of the granted organization. Add users here who should gain access to edit the data of the project.

DIALOG.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete a project grant. Are you sure?

ROLE.EMPTY: No role has been created yet.
ROLE.TITLE: Roles
ROLE.DESCRIPTION: Define some roles which can be used to create project-grants.
ROLE.NAME: Name
ROLE.ADDDESCRIPTION: Enter the data for the new role.
ROLE.EDITDESCRIPTION: Enter the new data for the role.
ROLE.SELECTGROUPTOOLTIP: Select all Roles of the group {{group}}.
ROLE.ASSERTION_DESCRIPTION: Role information is sent from Userinfo endpoint and depending on your application settings in tokens and other types.
ROLE.CHECK_DESCRIPTION: If set, users are only allowed to authenticate if any role is assigned to their account.

DIALOG.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete a project role. Are you sure?

PROJECT.HAS_PROJECT_DESCRIPTION: It is checked whether the user's organization has this project. If not, the user cannot be authenticated.

DIALOG.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete a role. Are you sure?

CREATE.TITLE: Add provider
CREATE.DESCRIPTION: Select one or more of the following providers.

OIDC.TITLE: OIDC Provider
OIDC.DESCRIPTION: Enter the required data for your OIDC provider.

OAUTH.TITLE: OAuth Provider
OAUTH.DESCRIPTION: Enter the required data for your OAuth provider.

JWT.TITLE: JWT Provider
JWT.DESCRIPTION: Enter the required data for your JWT provider.

GOOGLE.TITLE: Google Provider
GOOGLE.DESCRIPTION: Enter the credentials for your Google Identity Provider

GITLAB.TITLE: Gitlab Provider
GITLAB.DESCRIPTION: Enter the credentials for your Gitlab Identity Provider

GITLABSELFHOSTED.TITLE: Gitlab Self Hosted Provider
GITLABSELFHOSTED.DESCRIPTION: Enter the credentials for your Gitlab Self Hosted Identity Provider

GITHUBES.TITLE: GitHub Enterprise Server Provider
GITHUBES.DESCRIPTION: Enter the credentials for your GitHub Enterprise Server Identity Provider

GITHUB.TITLE: Github Provider
GITHUB.DESCRIPTION: Enter the credentials for your Github Identity Provider

AZUREAD.TITLE: Microsoft Provider
AZUREAD.DESCRIPTION: Enter the credentials for your Microsoft Identity Provider

LDAP.TITLE: Active Directory / LDAP
LDAP.DESCRIPTION: Enter the credentials for your LDAP Provider

APPLE.TITLE: Sign in with Apple
APPLE.DESCRIPTION: Enter the credentials for your Apple Provider

SAML.TITLE: Sign in with SAML
SAML.DESCRIPTION: Enter the credentials for your SAML Provider

OPTIONS.ISAUTOCREATION_DESC: If selected, an account will be created if it does not exist yet.
OPTIONS.ISAUTOUPDATE_DESC: If selected, accounts are updated on reauthentication.
OPTIONS.ISCREATIONALLOWED_DESC: Determines whether accounts can be created using an external account. Disable if users should not be able to edit account information when auto_creation is enabled.
OPTIONS.ISLINKINGALLOWED_DESC: Determines whether an identity can be manually linked to an existing account. Disable if users should only be allowed to link the proposed account in case of active auto_linking.
OPTIONS.AUTOLINKING_DESC: Determines whether an identity will be prompted to be linked to an existing account.

IDP.NAMEHINT: If specified it will be shown in the login interface.
IDP.NAME: Name
IDP.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete an identity provider. The resulting changes are irrevocable. Do you really want to do this?
IDP.REMOVE_WARN_DESCRIPTION: You are about to remove an identity provider. This will remove the selection of the available IdP for your users and already registered users won't be able to login again. Are you sure to continue?
IDP.DELETE_SELECTION_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete an identity provider. The resulting changes are irrevocable. Do you really want to do this?

OIDC.TITLE: OIDC Configuration
OIDC.DESCRIPTION: Enter the data for the OIDC Identity Provider.

JWT.TITLE: JWT Configuration
JWT.DESCRIPTION: Enter the data for JWT Identity Provider.

SAML.TRANSIENTMAPPINGATTRIBUTENAME_DESC: Alternative attribute name to map the user in case the `nameid-format` returned is `transient`, e.g. `http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress`

IDP.ISIDTOKENMAPPING_DESC: If selected, provider information gets mapped from the ID token, not from the userinfo endpoint.

LIST.MULTIFACTORDESCRIPTION: Define your Multifactors for your passwordless Authentication here.
LIST.SECONDFACTORDESCRIPTION: Define further possible factors with which you can secure your password authentication.

DELETE.TITLE: Delete Factor
DELETE.DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete a Factor from Login Settings. Are you sure?

MULTIFACTORTYPES.1: Fingerprint, Security Keys, Face ID and other

SECONDFACTORTYPES.1: One Time Password by Authenticator App (TOTP)
SECONDFACTORTYPES.2: Fingerprint, Security Keys, Face ID and other
SECONDFACTORTYPES.3: One Time Password by Email (Email OTP)
SECONDFACTORTYPES.4: One Time Password by SMS (SMS OTP)

CREATE.TITLE: Login Settings
CREATE.DESCRIPTION: Define how your users can be authenticated on your organization.

ADDIDP.TITLE: Add Identity Provider
ADDIDP.DESCRIPTION: You can select predefined or self-created providers for authentication.

LIST.TITLE: SMTP Provider
LIST.DESCRIPTION: These are the SMTP providers for your ZITADEL instance. Activate the one you want to use to send notifications to your users.

DIALOG.ACTIVATE_WARN_DESCRIPTION: You are about to activate an SMTP configuration. First we'll deactivate the current active provider and then activate this configuration. Are you sure?
DIALOG.DEACTIVATE_WARN_DESCRIPTION: You are about to deactivate an SMTP configuration. Are you sure?
DIALOG.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete a configuration. Confirm this action typing the sender name
DIALOG.SENDER: Type {{value}}, to delete this SMTP configuration.
DIALOG.TEST_DESCRIPTION: Specify an email address to test your SMTP configuration for this provider

CREATE.TITLE: Add SMTP provider
CREATE.DESCRIPTION: Select one or more of the following providers.

STEPS.TITLE: Add {{ value }} SMTP Provider
STEPS.CREATE_DESC_TITLE: Enter your {{ value }} SMTP settings step by step

ACTIVATE.TITLE: Activate your SMTP Provider
ACTIVATE.DESCRIPTION: ZITADEL cannot use this SMTP Provider to send notifications until you activate it. If you activate this provider any other provider that was active will now be deactivated.

DEACTIVATE.TITLE: Deactivate your SMTP Provider
DEACTIVATE.DESCRIPTION: If you deactivate this SMTP Provider, ZITADEL cannot use it to send notifications until you activate it again.

TEST.TITLE: Test your settings
TEST.DESCRIPTION: You can test your SMTP provider settings and check the test result before saving them

PAGES.TITLE: Application
PAGES.DESCRIPTION: Here you can edit your application data and it's configuration.
PAGES.CREATE_NEW_PROJECT: or enter the name for your new project
PAGES.CREATE_DESC_TITLE: Enter Your Application Details Step by Step
PAGES.CREATE_DESC_SUB: A recommended configuration will be automatically generated.
PAGES.JUMPTOPROJECT: To configure roles, authorizations and more, navigate to the project.

DELETE.TITLE: Delete App
DELETE.DESCRIPTION: Do you really want to delete this application?

1.TITLE: Add users
1.DESC: Add new users of your organization

2.TITLE: Help & Support
2.DESC: Read our documentation on creating applications or contact our support

NAMEDIALOG.TITLE: Rename App
NAMEDIALOG.DESCRIPTION: Enter the new name for your app
NAMEDIALOG.NAME: New Name

APP.NAME: Name
APP.ADDITIONALORIGINSDESC: If you want to add additional Origins to your app which is not used as a redirect you can do that here.
APP.NOTANORIGIN: The entered value is not an origin
APP.PROSWITCH: I'm a pro. Skip this wizard.

OIDC.WELLKNOWN: Further links can be retrieved from the discovery endpoint.
OIDC.REDIRECTTITLE: Specify the URIs where the login will redirect to.
OIDC.POSTREDIRECTTITLE: This is the redirect URI after logout.
OIDC.REDIRECTDESCRIPTIONWEB: Redirect URIs must begin with https://. http:// is only valid with enabled development mode.
OIDC.REDIRECTDESCRIPTIONNATIVE: Redirect URIs must begin with your own protocol, http://127.0.0.1, http://[::1] or http://localhost.
OIDC.REDIRECTNOTVALID: This redirect URI is not valid.
OIDC.TITLE: OIDC Configuration
OIDC.CLIENTSECRET_NOSECRET: With your chosen authentication flow, no secret is required and is therefore not available.
OIDC.CLIENTSECRET_DESCRIPTION: Keep your client secret at a safe place as it will disappear once the dialog is closed.
OIDC.DEVMODEDESC: Beware: With development mode enabled redirect URIs will not be validated.
OIDC.SKIPNATIVEAPPSUCCESSPAGE_DESCRIPTION: Skip the success page after a login for this native app.
OIDC.GRANTTITLE: Select your grant types. Note: Implicit is only available for browser-based applications.
OIDC.UNSECUREREDIRECT: I sure hope you know what you are doing.
OIDC.OVERVIEWTITLE: You are now done. Review your configuration.
OIDC.ACCESSTOKENROLEASSERTION: Add user roles to the access token
OIDC.ACCESSTOKENROLEASSERTION_DESCRIPTION: If selected, the requested roles of the authenticated user are added to the access token.
OIDC.IDTOKENROLEASSERTION_DESCRIPTION: If selected, the requested roles of the authenticated user are added to the ID token.
OIDC.IDTOKENUSERINFOASSERTION_DESCRIPTION: Enables clients to retrieve profile, email, phone and address claims from ID token.
OIDC.CLOCKSKEW: Enables clients to handle clock skew of OP and client. The duration (0-5s) will be added to exp claim and subtracted from iats, auth_time and nbf.

WEB.TITLE: Web
WEB.DESCRIPTION: Regular Web applications like .net, PHP, Node.js, Java, etc.

NATIVE.TITLE: Native
NATIVE.DESCRIPTION: Mobile Apps, Desktop, Smart Devices, etc.

USERAGENT.TITLE: User Agent
USERAGENT.DESCRIPTION: Single Page Applications (SPA) and in general all JS frameworks executed in browsers

SAML.CHOOSEMETADATASOURCE: Provide your SAML configuration using one of the following options:
SAML.METADATAOPT1: Option 1. Specify the url where metadata file is located
SAML.METADATAOPT2: Option 2. Upload a file containing your metadata XML
SAML.METADATAOPT3: Option 3. Create a minimal metadata file on the fly providing ENTITYID and ACS URL

CODE.TITLE: Code
CODE.DESCRIPTION: Exchange the authorization code for the tokens

PKCE.TITLE: PKCE
PKCE.DESCRIPTION: Use a random hash instead of a static client secret for more security

POST.TITLE: POST
POST.DESCRIPTION: Send client_id and client_secret as part of the form

PK_JWT.TITLE: Private Key JWT
PK_JWT.DESCRIPTION: Use a private key to authorize your application

IMPLICIT.TITLE: Implicit
IMPLICIT.DESCRIPTION: Get the tokens directly from the authorization endpoint

DEVICECODE.TITLE: Device Code
DEVICECODE.DESCRIPTION: Authorize the device on a computer or smartphone.

CUSTOM.TITLE: Custom
CUSTOM.DESCRIPTION: Your setting doesn't correspond to any other option.

DIALOG.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to remove a manager. Are you sure?

GRANTS.TITLE: Authorizations
GRANTS.DESC: These are all authorizations on your organization.

PROJECT.TITLE: Authorization
PROJECT.DESCRIPTION: Define authorizations for the specified project. Note that you can only see entries of projects and users for which you have the permissions.

USER.TITLE: Authorization
USER.DESCRIPTION: Define authorizations for the specified user. Note that you can only see entries of projects and users for which you have the permissions.

DETAIL.TITLE: Authorization Detail
DETAIL.DESCRIPTION: Here you can see all the details of the authorization.
